alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 2:51PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Chena River Upstream of the Moose Creek Dam. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas such as parking lots, boat launches, picnic areas and campgrounds in the Chena River Recreation area. Low lying roads and driveways near the Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek Dam may become impassable. Logs and debris will float down the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As of 3PM Friday, the Chena River crested at Chena Lakes/Moose Creek dam Friday morning, expecting to crest below flood stage in downtown Fairbanks Friday evening. Water levels are forecasted to continue to fall through the weekend. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc People along the Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek dam should stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
